alert.note: Alert for Polk; San Jacinto (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 05 at 10:53PM CDT by NWS Houston - Galveston
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of eastern San Jacinto and southeastern Polk Counties through 1130 PM CDT... At 1053 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 8 miles southwest of Alabama-Coushatta Reservation, or 10 miles southeast of Livingston, moving northeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Livingston, Alabama-Coushatta Reservation, northeastern West Livingston, Segno and Leggett. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
